reviews.review: Learn about local art and origines. The heritage of Balinese art is to be found here. I found out about the influences that gave birth to painting and wood carving. It is a journey from the late 19 century to contemporary time; you will see exceptional work hosted in 4 buildings, each hosting artworks from a specific time period. The journey is well worth spending 2 hours if you like to read the descriptions and dive into the Magical and Mystical world of This part of great Indonesia ...

Home of Ida Bagus Made. Good art museum. Unfortunately, facing tough competition, as Ubud is pretty much the unofficial Capital of Art. Still well worth a visit, assuming that you have already seen Neka and ARMA (as this is more of the same). This museum is hosting the best collection of works by Ida Bagus Made Poleng (probably the second best Balinese artist after I Gusti Nyoman Lempad).

Totally dissappointing after seeing ARMA & Antonio Blanco Arts Museum. Totally dissappointing after enjoying the ARMA ( Ayung Rai Museum of Arts near Monkey Forest Sanctuary ) & Antonio Blanco Arts Museum, jusr 5-7 minutes walk away from this museum. It is spread in 4 buildings East-West-North-South , but the displayed arts work is not worth the high entry tickets charged, when compared to the displays at ARMA & A Blanco Arts Museum. Hence, do not waste time & money on this museum
Lots to see. Lots to see, but it didn't particularly appeal to me, I preferred the temporary exhibits, much more my taste

Great trip back in balinese time through art. This was awesome for the whole family, reasonable price for the tickets including free tea/juice at the restaurant and the whole place laid out in historical periods across different buildings. Some awesome pieces of art depicting Bali's history, the buildings were nicely airconditioned or had good fans to keep you cool, the gardens were also well maintained.

Balinese art. the oldest museum in Bali use the oldest style of lighting in its displays. So a number of the works a very hard to see. There are four building and you follow the history of balinese art through these buildings. Well worth a visit

Bit expensive but not a waste. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a bit of break and wants to chill out looking at some great art. The exhibitions were beautiful, as is the garden, but I felt that it was quite expensive as I had seen it all in about 30 mins and that was with reading all the painting signs. There was also a few tourist buses here which meant that the cafe place they have was too full to use. Great to do if you want to mooch about or if it is raining (it was for my visit).

To appreciate art and culture of Ancestors. this museum is the oldest museum in Ubud, collected a lot of arts..paintings, scluptures that were made by local artis.it very fascinating..they are doing a good works, and dedicated their life for preserve the art and culture of Bali.we apprecited it..thank you.

Fascinating museum/gallery. A hot and rainy day in Ubud but we enjoyed our visit here. A great showcase of ancient and contemporary Balinese craft and art skills. The museum cafe has a very authentic Balinese/Indonesian menu.
very informative. Lots paintings from Balinese artists. There are 4 buildings to cover. It took us just about an hour. An afternoon tea/drinks from the restaurant is included in the price.

Motley but fascinating collection, poorly displayed. 4 separate buildings housed a vast collection. Really need a guide to assist with allegorical details. Staff surly. But it's still a worthwhile experience for insight into Balinese culture. The gardens are terrific and the lotus pool picture perfect. There were also private paintings for sale, mostly upwards of $US 5,000.
Dark rooms made viewing art challenging. Although there is a lot of historical art present, some poor lighting made viewing challenging. Go to Rudana or ARMA instead.
Maybe for art lovers?. I am not one and didn't see anything extraordinary here. 3-4 rooms with art which was interesting but Bali itself is one giant art museum.
Very nice museum. Very nice. We visited it in a couple of hours and it really was a nice break from crazy motorcycle full Ubud :-)

Beautiful art. Showcasing traditional Balinese art and history behind some artists. There are 4 buildings to explore with different categories or art by era, the art was stunning. There's is a cafeteria also although we didn't use it. The gardens are lovely. Good value for money and your ticket fee is what keeps the museum running. Recommend if you're into art. As with most museums flash photography is not permitted.

One of the better museums in asia. If youre interested in balinese art or history, this museum is worth a visit.i loved seeing the balinese paintings.museum had very modern interior, an awesome green garden, and you can also get a free drink in the restaurant.

Worth visiting!. It's worth visiting if you want to became familiar with Indonesian art in a short time :)) Ticket price is around 85k rupees but there's a drink from a restaurant included in the price.

Beautiful museum with important Balinese art. Museum is in the center of Ubud and houses some of the most important work made by Balinese painters. In four buildings, you find paintings belonging to different ages with often some information near the work. Keep in mind that Balinese painting is relative new and don't expect any abstract or contemporary art. We visited the museum ourselves and could find enough information to understand the transition from traditional art as a form of religious believes to painting for pleasure. Most works are nicely conserved, however the oldest paintings are perishing. Also, the location is very quite with a nice garden to escape the busy Ubud center!

Beautiful. The Puri Lukisan Museum is a beautifull place to visit! Not only because of the building itself but the paintings are exquisite. Unfortunately we didn't have enough time to visit the whole exposition, but the part we did see was beautifull.

Worth the visit. This is Ubud's Municipal Art Museum. It has a lot of significant traditional art and art associated with Ubud region in the 20th and 21st century. Paintings are better conserved in recent years, but still they hang too close for proper display, and ofter dimly lit. It is nevertheless really important to see what you can.

a bit hermetic. A bit complicated to integrate balinese graphic culture. try to get a guide or read something about before.
Splendid buildings....Everybody pretends having been visiting this museum but we were alone !
Beautiful art. The museum is home to some amazing art. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. There are several buildings on the property to see, the map is very helpful.

Best museum in Ubud. Display is beautiful, specially the south building collection. Centrally located. Great outline. Try to combine your visit with one of their cultural workshops. Worth every single penny.

Nice museum, but a bit boring. This museum shows Balinese art of the past (half) century. Interesting to see, but also a bit repetitive. Also, the museum could do with a bit more/better explanation. The wood carvings deserve special attention. In the entree fee, a drink is included.

Interesting insight into Bali's history and art. This museum, which consists of five or so buildings and grounds, was created by the then-King, local artists, and several Westerners who had settled in Ubud in the 1920's and 30's. I don't know enough to appreciate the art fully, though I enjoyed walking through the galleries. What I came away with was a strong appreciation for the enduring value of the effort that was invested, now almost a century ago, in nurturing and preserving the work of local artists. There is quite a lot of information about the king, whose deep interest and engagement in this project laid the foundation for Ubud's development as a destination for artists. We learned about some of the local masters, whose breadth of talent was stunning and fascinating. Also interesting was the information about those early Western artists and adventurous bohemians who spent their adult lives here and clearly contributed to promoting and preserving local art. We were there on a rainy day early in our week-long stay in Ubud, and definitely found that the history we learned at this museum enriched and informed the rest of our stay.

Great collection. Beautiful museum compound.. First to note is the museum compound itself. Very pretty, very Bali. Lovely and well maintained.The paintings collections are housed in 4 different buildings located nearby. I found the collections amazing and mesmerizing. Definitely a must visit when you are in Ubud. I plan to come back again.

Beautiful collection of various styles of Balinese art in a pleasant surrounding. For those spending a few days or longer in Ubud, this centrally located museum is great to spend a few hours admiring the art (and the many photographs of the King of Ubud). There is also a lovely restaurant.

Great place to see some Art. I'm always interested in museum and particularly when I was in Ubud, this one was on my list to visit. I didn't expect to pay anything but it does ask for entrance ticket and for me as a budget traveler, it's a bit expensive. However, we got in free of charge, thanks to my friend who has a travel business.I was only inside the main building that displayed mostly traditional paintings. Good arrangement and the area was clean and spacey. The garden is also nice for taking pictures or just a short walk.The museum also offers a package of entrance ticket and meals.
Interesting art exhibits. This is a nice place to spend an hour or two away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud streets. Nice buildings and out of the sun with interesting exhibits.
Magnificent grounds. While the art was very interesting much of it was not to my tastehowever it was still very enjoyable and the grounds were great.

Dusty. Not quite the Louvre, but go. The slightly ramshakle-ness of the place adds to the feeling.... the buildings and gardens are interestingly designed.... it's a surreal, transporting experience... And the peek into the history of the art of the island really adds texture to one's visit...

Interesting museum and art gallery. Small but interesting museum with some great pieces of art. The grounds were beautiful but they were holding an marketing event so the entrance had many stalls and marquees. Still we enjoyed our visit

Nice Traditional Museum!. The museum is set in a nice traditional setting with a lotus lake , meandering paths and across separate sections. so you an take a break, the wander and see more. The art displayed is wonderful and spare time to read as you go along as you will then enjoy it even more!The entry ticket entitles you to s free drink and snack which is worth it and much appreciated too!

Great overview of Bali see art. Museum grounds beautiful and nice escape from busy street. Enjoying a cold drink before touring museum galleries reenergized us. Individual art pieces are not well lit which distracts from their enjoyment.

Good overview of Balinese Art. The setting is lovely and there is enough parking for visitors. It is situated close to the market and can easily be reached on foot.The gallery consists of several exhibition halls and restaurant facilities.The exhibits cover traditional Balinese art dating from the early 1900's to the present. One gallery houses an array of earlier work which presents scenes from daily life, rituals and mythical and religious drawings and paintings. A lot of these earlier works are monochromatic, but the later work is much more colourful.The second gallery houses more paintings of daily life, agriculture, landscapes and flowers.The third gallery is dedicated to more contemporary work which is for sale to the public The drawings and paintings vary in quality, but there are some excellent artworks amongst the selection that are sold at competitive prices. The quality of the work is far better than the art generally sold to tourists in other places.This gallery will be of particular interest to visitors interested in the development of art in Bali. The only serious draw back is the lack of good lighting. Brochures with more information on the art would also be helpful, especially for people without a particular art background. The gallery would also benefit from a proper web page to promote themselves and to give tourists more information about the gallery.

Nice place to take a stroll. Visited while in Ubud, a good chance to see local art located in a very nice place. The first three pavilions all had pretty much the same type of local art, dating from a long way back and the fourth building had some interesting historical photos and information. Your entrance fee includes a drink and snack in the cafe and this was a good chance to take a break while touring the town. The grounds were specacular.
Nice afternoon. Be on the lookout for crafts people. They are very willing and happy to discuss their work. The prices will be high, but generally you can count on the quality.

An unexpected delight. We are very familiar with Anthonio Blanco and Neka museum, but my wife accidentally spotted this museum when we were strolling down from Ubud Palace.To be honest, from the front gate it somewhat seemed that this place we're closed. I was hesitant to go in because it seemed kind of dodgy, but my adventurous fiancé insisted to go through with it and in we did.We paid an entrance fee of around $7 which is kind of steep for this kind of attractions. The price was written clearly on the ticket as to avoid petty corruptions. The staff in the entrance was nice and helpful.There are four studios available, each with arrays of paintings and sculptures with simple descriptions relating them to the history of art and mythological stories of bali. My fiancé who is a true art buff really enjoyed the museum, while I (a more pragmatic tourist) got bored after a few runs through the paintings.All in all it was still a nice surprised and we would recommend those who enjoy good art to visit this place!
For art lovers. Museum describes hostory of bali art, mostly paintings and wooden sculptures through bali history till recent. Nice cafe in yard a possiblity to purchase some art

Strangely interesting. What an idea to teach locals painting after their great history of art... However, nice to have initiated and built this place in all its tranquil beauty. You forget about colonial patriarchial habits, however, they dont let you forget after all.

Best museum in Ubud. During my stay in Ubud I visited four museums. I liked Museum Puri Lukisan the most. Different kinds of art are shown in four buildings. The painting 'Ubud market' took most of my time, it's beautiful. Also there are many (wooden) sculptures. The entrance fee is relatively high, but it's worth it (you also get a 'free' drink when you bought a ticket).

Several Buildings and Beautiful Grounds. This museum is on the main road in Ubud close to the center. The first building had the most artwork I was interested in viewing and it had a number of photos as well. Really worth the time!

Hurry is a fault. Not far from Ubud palace, you can find the museum with five buildings that exhibits traditional as well as contemporary artworks. As compare with her counterpart Neka museum, she has a rich collection of paintings, most of them are chiefly related with Baliese mythology and Hindu legend. Pay more attention to Walter Spies, Rudolf Bonnet, Tjokorda Gde Agung Sukawati and I Gusti Nyoman Lempad's paintings, especially the latter two Indonesian painters. It is worthwhile to see, the essence of her collection and her garden not in a hurry,for at least two more hours , Besides, you can enjoy a free drink in her restaurant at the entrance after your tour.
Worth a look. Amazing selection of contemporary and traditional art depicting life and their connection with Hindu legend.
Good collection. Good collection of art depiciting balinese mythology , tradition & culture. with a garden in the midst. No A/c in museum - it was hot and uncomfortable.

A Place Not to Be Missed. An excellent place to visit when in Ubud where you can learn about the culture and the history of the area.Allow plenty of time because is a big place and lots of exhibitsor do it in two lots.
Stunning. Fantastic collection of modern and traditional Balinese painting in a stunning setting. Well curated with explanations in English.

Heritage Balinese art. We visited the museum and it was a very good experience, special because you have the opportunity to see amazing art work. Wonderful carvings and the Paints were just a master piece.

Balinese art treasures and tranquil gardens. A cafe provides refreshing drinks between meanderings [there are 4 separate bldgs and little a/c]. Like most museums in busy cities, it is a refuge as well as a feast for the eye. An easy way to absorb traditional art in Bali.Go for the afternoon tea and escape the oppression of hottest heat in the city.

Island of Culture. Yes, a good collection of traditional painting and carving and a stark contrast to the noisy, crass, traffic dominated pseudo art outside the front door. Sad to consider how much has been lost in the last 70 years or so. So stop in and look. Then get in your car and go elsewhere. The rest of central Ubud is oppressive and debased.

Tranquil and Beautiful Space. Stroll through the lovely gardens and enjoy the many examples of traditional and modern Balinese art at this wonderful museum in central Ubud. Our admission came with afternoon tea at the very nice outdoor restaurant.

outstanding museum collection in four buildings downtown. This museum collection is extensive, and will need more than a casual visit to appreciate. The gardens are stunning as well, and I was enchanted by the entire experience. The staff serve complementary coffee or tea as a refresher, and I found the depth of the art collection to be enlightening and educational. DON'T MISS THIS PLACE, right downtown.
Traditional Balinese Art. Paintings in the old style with good descriptions, sculptures, woodwork. Great restaurant and the grounds are well kept.

Enjoyable art collection in beautiful grounds. There are four separate buildings housing 20th century and contemporary Balinese artwork. Most are not air conditioned, so we repeatedly visited the cafe on the grounds for a cold drink between buildings. The collection includes some beautiful pieces and does an excellent job of showing how the arrival of European artists and visitors in the early 20th century affected the local art scene.

Wood-carving classes - highly recommended!. Our two boys aged 12 & 16 spent a whole day here doing a wood-carving class. They each produced a square block carving of the sort used to decorate around temple doors; one with an elephant and the other with a deer. The tutor was endlessly patient with them and the end result is simply stunning! Many of the wood carving classes available in Ubud are a 3-4 hour affair and we were advised that you really needed a full day to produce something worth taking home. It cost Rp520,000 per person which included all materials, 7 hours of tuition, morning and afternoon tea and a huge,sumptuous lunch. The classes are only done with very small groups (actually our boys had the tutor to themselves!) and I felt it was well worth paying the extra money for them to go the extra mile. Elsewhere you can do a wood carving class in Ubud for US$20-30 but having seen the simple end results made in these classes I would definitely recommend this one. Not suitable for very young children or any young people with a limited concentration span, but perfect for ours or for adults who want to bring home something special from their Bali trip.

Beautiful grounds and four galleries of Balinese art and wood carvings. . A fine collection is Balinese paintings and wood carvings in four galleries set in beautiful gardens. The venue also has a restaurant for drinks or a meal. Plan on two hours for this tour.

Amazing art. Well worth a visit - the art is absolutely stunning, and often there's text to explain the piece, on the wall beside the art. Nice afternoon tea is included in your entry fee. Very reasonably priced.

spent the day making my own shadow puppet.. I didn't get a chance to explore the three galleries here this time (the last time I was here was some 18 years ago!) this time I booked in for a puppet making course which went for 7 hours - including an hour lunch break with a tasty meal at the cafe. I was guided through the process of creating a leather shadow puppet which was interesting and enjoyable chatting to the young puppet maker who had begun making puppets aged 10. The grounds are gorgeous and it was a lovely way to spend a day, although with a dodgey back sitting cross legged on a Pavillon at a low table was a tad uncomfortable (a bit painful really ) but worth it!

Interesting view on Balinese art. If you're mildly interested in art and curious to see what Balinese art looks like then definitely pay the Puri Lukisan museum a visit. The temporary exhibition had some really great paintings, of which many were available for purchase albeit a little pricey. The entrance ticket is a little bit steep but you get a free drink with it. The museum is on Raya Ubud and easy to find. The only downside is that it can get a bit hot inside since they only have fans.

Easy to get through. It's a nice place. Even if you don't fall in love with Balinese pre and post war culture, you can easily walk through the 4 small rooms and get a snapshot at least of Balinese culture.

Interesting Cultural Spot. Went here 2 personFounded by Tjokorda Agung and 2 others (foreigners who fell in love with Bali The Island Of God)Lots of well kept collection, some of them were gift and donations from other countryYou can see Tjok handwriting in this museum, his life history along with his photographAlso you can see several letters from influential people such as JFK to Tjokorda Agung whom also certified as PHD from Holland if I am not mistakenEntrance fee was Rp 85k per person. Parking for car was Rp 2 to 5k. Entrance fee is including welcome drink for every each personThey also have restaurant, exhibition hall and art class: gamelan music class, flute and also dancing classThe parking security usually a bit cautious since some people used their parking spot without entering the museumCheers...
Great museum. Spent a wonderful morning here looking at all the art. Well displayed and also have staff that will walk around with you explaining the exhibitions to you.

Dull artwork but great cultural lessons. The majority of the artwork is pre and post war balinese work. Alot of the work is very similar and is spread across 4 buildings which make up the entire museum, their is very little variation in style, it honstly isn't worth going. If you decide to go, make sure you get your drink at the cafe which is included in the ticket price. Despite NOT recommending the museum they do run various classes, Balinese flute lesson, shadow puppet making, balinese dance lessons etc. These have to be book at least a day in advance but are totally worth it, and the classes are always individual or really small. They range from $15-70AUD depending on if it is a 1hour or 7 hour class.
Great selection of Balinese art. Beautiful gardens at the hotel and good few different galleries with Balinese art.Good restaurant to have a lunch.Admission could be cheaper.

A small collection at a big price. This gallery claims to be a historical landmark and the biggest and most impressive collection in Ubud. But the artwork was poorly displayed, and without much information about the artists and their cultural history.I am usually more than happy to pay to view artwork, but at $8AUD per person, this was probably not worth the visit.
Great Art and Helpful Staff. A great way to spend a couple of hours, with some unique art and carvings to admire. Taking your time here is a must as art work is very intricate.
Balinese art. Set in gardens, traditional balinese art through ages.Surprise is with your ticket you get a choice of drink and a delightful plate of sweet appetisers!

Good for traditional, but ARMA is way better. Needs dusting!. All of the four houses have mostly traditional balineise religious paintings and tapestrys. Gets a bit old (which they are) and lacks depth and contrasts which I loved in many of the paintings in ARMA. I got allergic reactions from the dust in all the rooms, besides the one which switches exhibits (Guess it gets cleaned frequently). The fans just throws it around in the air.
Ubud art. A very good museum to have a look at the different types of art during the years. Interesting and good selection.

Too Much Same Same. Don't get me wrong. The garden and grounds are lovely and peaceful and there are many very beautiful works of art here. But unless you have a special interest in Hindu/Balinese mythology, in which case you will be a pig in mud, the collection becomes quite monotonous. A few have interesting English translations, but most do not. After a while it is like looking at the same thing over and over again. And unfortunately there is only one underlying style. Oh, I'm sure that each artist has their own, but I am not trained enough to appreciate it. Nearly all the paintings, and even sculptures, are extremely busy. There is so much going on. One could look at each picture for twenty minutes. I just got overwhelmed. On a practical basis, some of the rooms have no windows, dim lights (spend some money on LED) and faded paintings. My old eyes were not up to the task. The entry is rather steep at 85,000R, comparable to some European museums with much more extensive collections. The place was nearly empty. Many young travelers come to Ubud, and they are not able or willing to pay this much. Put the entry down to 50K and you will increase attendance enough to improve receipts. The entry includes tea in the restaurant, but they only have plain black tea or coffee, no herbal tea or even green tea. They can do better.

Very interesting museum. Usually I walk quickly through a museum, but this one kept me for 2 hours. I was fascinated by the pictures, the art which Indonesia has to offer. I stood in front of some paintings for a few minutes to see what the artist wanted to tell us and I am not really good in understanding art usually. This museum showed me that art can be different, fun and interesting.
Lots of Art. Big space with several buildings full of Indonesian art. If you're interested in that type of thing I would go!

Excellent range of balinese art with relaxing grounds. This is somewhat hidden off the street but well worth a visit if you want to see classic balinese art. Nice range of art with classic to more modern styles. Also stop in the grounds and enjoy a cold drink with a nice fountain and some shade.

Balinese art at its best!. A great museum, not particularly cheap at 85,000 but it's definitely worth it and comes with a free drink at the cafe (where they weren't pushy at all about us ordering food- which did look really good). The only museum we visited but we felt it was all we needed to appreciate both old and modern Balinese art.

Just Art. I found the newer paintings more interesting than the older ones. I guess you need to know more about the old paintings to appreciate them. There was a lot of detail in the new paintings that were located in the left hand side building and most were for sale, but at high prices that you would expect. None of the buildings are air conditioned, at best are a few fans scattered round. The gardens have been nicely looked after. This museum is just for those who are interested in the Balinese art.

For art lovers. Rp.85k entrance fee. You have to be a Balinese art lover to really enjoy this museum. The best part for me was the new art rather than the old stuff. The grounds of the museum are good and deserve a walk round.

A Balinese Delight.. I always visit the Museum Puri Lukisan for its great art collection of traditional Balinese art. It is set just off Jalan Raya Ubud where the car park is huge but in need of a bit of repair. But the tranquil surrounds make up for that. The galleries are set back into the hill but the walk and incline are moderate. The grounds are so relaxing. I have bought brunch and lunch at the restaurant/cafe. The drinks are always chilled and the staff are divine.

Interesting - where is everybody?. There are 4 separate buildings containing paintings and carvings to view. I really enjoyed the carvings done from the jack fruit tree - really intricate. We were there for an hour and only saw a maximum of 6 other tourists. Guess they don't know what they are missing.
not the best museum in town. There are few interesting works, its better to visit one of the 3 most important musea. There is also a temporary exhibition but it are only some works to sell

Great Art Exhibition . It is a very nice and peaceful museum. There are some nice artistic landscaped gardens and pond. It displays some good nice Balinese art paintings and few artworks. It is like an art painting exhibitions/gallery, well presented and explained. Definitely worth visiting..Love it!!

Great painting course. Love this museum, it has some interesting art and it is also has pretty garden and little restaurant. This time we took a traditional painting course, a lot of fun. A snack and lunch was included in the price, and we left with a painting each and a good sense of achievement. They offer other courses too.
Good representation. A nice collection of modern Balinese paintings. The architecture is splendid. Not exactly wheelchair friendly. Not sure if they rotate the exhibits.
Well set out display of mostly modern Balinese art. A nice collection of art from 1800 to present day set out over four buildings. Lovely grounds to wander through.

Beautiful paintings . Beautiful 4 buildings with collection of paintings situated in rice paddy field kind of setting. When Yiu roam around Bali Yiu realise the inspiration of the paintings is the Bali landscapes and the rich culture here. The level of detailing by artists is mind boggling. If you have taste for art, this is must visit.
Artistic Museum. Artistic museum in the middle of ubud town. Many good art work and paintings to see. Glad to see good maintenance and well organizing of many art work made by famous painters.

Wonderful shadow puppet workshop!. Took a shadow puppet making workshop! Wonderful!
My teacher was kind, patient and very informative. She gave just the right amount of assistance and guidance. A delicious lunch was included as well.

Stunning museum in the heart of Ubud. The Puri Lukisan Museum was originally founded in 1936 as the Pitamaha Artist Cooperative by Tjokorda Gde Agung Sukawati (the King of Ubud) and Tjokorda Gde Raka Sukawati (the King’s brother) along with two western artists working in Bali at the time: Walter Spies and Rudolf Bonnet. Its mission was to preserve and develop traditional Balinese art. It is now the oldest art museum in Bali, specialising in modern traditional Balinese paintings and wood carvings, spanning from the pre-Independence war (1930–1945) to the post-Independence war (1945 – present) era. The collection includes important examples of all of the artistic styles in Bali including the Sanur, Batuan, Ubud, Young Artist and Keliki schools. Beautifully situated in resplendent gardens.

Interesting view of art in Ubud through the ages. Lots of different paintings to look at in different buildings with a great explanation of history, we went on the one day (I think Tuesday) a visiting artist that specializes in drawing on palm leafs was in, he gave us a great history lesson on the art form and his artwork. Was interesting and would appeal to people who love art, we got bored after a while as it was a bit repetitive but the visiting artist and one of the buildings full of art for sale were worth the visit.
Great art in a great setting. Four galleries of beautiful Balinese painting, organized by style and period. Resplendent garden and lawn.

Must SEE. If you really want to sink into the culture of this place, this museum in particular should not be missed, the variety of the pieces is such, that there is no way you can get bored, each picture is more exiting, intriguing and colorful than the one before, the level of creativity here is vast.
Museum and garden not to be missed. Great place to see old and new paintings of Indonesian artists. Very moving history of its founders. Beautiful garden and good souvenir shop

The whole place is a lovely garden too. Take your time , and enjoy this museum while the garden is also interesting .If you have luck , like we had , a gamelan groups plays and had thier training too on that place .
Great artwork. Great place to view classic Balinese artwork. I really enjoyed seeing the variety of paints here. I recommend for any who has loved Balinese art.

Museum artworks. Definitely worth a visit. The 4 different buildings, containing art works from different ages. Lovely settings and gardens surrounding buildings. If you are a lover of artworks it's a must see.
I particularly loved the last building containing the really aged pieces. Big concern was these pieces should have been preserved behind glass.

Recommended. It is a great escape from the chaos of the Ubud main street. They have lovely garden and several beautiful buildings. There is a lot of mostly Hindu art. Our ticket price included a dessert and coffee at the cafe. I don't how they make money considering the ticket price was so cheap to begin with.

Nice and quiet museum!. Very nice and quiet museum, a lot of local paintings and works of art worth to see. 4 pavilions with a small park & pond in the middle, doesn't take too long to visit completely.
PuriLukisan Temple. Easily the most serene temple we visited in Bali. Spend some time here. You will need a driver to find this. Easy to get to from Jatiluwhi.

Beautiful museum, excellent collection of Balinese art. Excellent introduction into Balinese fine arts, beautiful and quite comprehensive collection of paintings and sculpture. Lots of unique pieces old and new, very well curated, English explanations and labels for everything. The museum has 4 buildings each housing a different period, you can see everything in 1 hour or if you like to take it more slowly 2 hours would be ideal. Gorgeous grounds as well, very calm and atmospheric.

If you are interested in Balinese art, this museum is a must!. Puri Lukisan Museum, centrally located on the main street is definitely worth a visit for broad look at a fine collection of traditional and modern pieces of art including painting, sculpture, and architecture. To enhance one's knowledge and pleasure there is very good and interesting signage. The museum also includes i a delightful garden with lotus pond which includes a landmark sculpture which arises from tree roots. It is definitely worth a visit for an hour or two while strolling down Jalan Raya.

Not much to see. There's really not much to see in this museum. Just several buildings with paintings hanging on the walls. I wouldn't recommend this if you're not a fan of Balinese arts.It is not expensive though.
a peaceful respite from busy Ubud. a lovely peaceful museum with beautiful grounds where you can escape the bustle of Ubud and gain an appreciation of real Balinese art
Nice art pieces. This museum displays some nice balinese paintings and has a beautifully landscaped garden. A must visit.

Not really a museum, more an exhibition of paintings.. I'd read some of the comments, so knew what to expect. The museum is spread over 4 buildings, all with different eras.Don't expect centuries old paintings, the oldest are around 1910-1920. Having said that, they are some very interesting pieces, both paintings and wood sculptures. The modern section was totally uninteresting for me, looks more like a Year 12 art exhibition. Some of the old paintings on wood are in poor conditions which is rather sad.i did like the stories about Rudolf Bonnet and Walter Spies and the link with the then king of Ubud, very interesting section.
Very interesting. I found the stories behind the paintings fascinating and the painting that intrigued me the most was "Just Punishments in Hell'. Definitely worth walking through.

A really nice museum!. This museum are located in the center of Ubud. Though we need to pay quite expensive to make a visit (50-75k rupiahs/person) but found out the museum and the collections were well-maintained. No regrets! If you like to enjoy paintings, this museum is a must visit in Ubud.

Come for the museum, come back for a workshop. The beautiful gardens and buildings are a great setting for some fantastic art. Paintings start from 500 year old traditional to modern works. Buy a ticket and come back another day for a hands-on workshop. I scored a one-to-one class with a very patient teacher, and left with a teak panel showing the signs of what could amount to wood carving one day. Challenging, demanding and fun.
Traditional Art. Loved seeing all the gallerys. I enjoyed the traditional art work most. Great grounds, pleasant afternoon.

Highly recommended museum. This museum traces Balinese art from traditional to contemporary. Well presented and explained, the art is located in four cool galleries. Very centrally located in Ubud, it provides a quiet getaway from the traffic and market hustle.
Nice for a dander. Good selection of local and expat works for an overview of Balinese art. They sometimes have good exhibitions
Best Museum in Ubud. Use this to help you put Balinese Ubud style art in context. We liked the grounds and each of the four buildings.

wonderfull. the whole collection was authentic.Real good artists who made those things.
there should be an demonstration of making batik but sad enough there was nobody to show that.

Balinese Art Museum. The setting for the museum itself is nice, but the exhibits are underwhelming. Mostly paintings and photos but doesn't include alot of explanation as to the significance. If you're into Balinese art or paintings in general then you'll enjoy the exhibits within the four separate museum exhibit halls. Not a good stop for small kids, they'll be bored to tears. The admission price includes tea/soft drink at the museum cafe. Bathrooms are available on site as well. A nice, relaxed setting, but not much in the way of interesting exhibits.

Excellent old and new balinese art.. If You come to Bali and see all shops with stone and woodcarvings and paintings at the markeds and shops and along the streets...some is amazing at first sight. If you visit the studios and workshops behind the artists its even more original and better. The museum will blow your mind with art of high class . Present and the past. Bali has a unique art tradition and some of the present artist are working i groups like Lempoyang art community(founded 1985). The community is very social and combine art with the local spirit and heart and perform in local community and village. See Kommunitas Lempoyang on Facebook. They have strong representation in a present exibition in the museum, Ketut Jaya and Made Buddhiana. Go go go.

Visit this museum first. We have visited all the major Balinese art museums in Ubud and this by far is high up there on our list and not to be missed. Their explanations regarding the various schools of Balinese art are extremely well done and the the art is well displayed. The gardens are magnificent and it is lovely to sit in their restaurant and enjoy a free cool drink after viewing the beautiful art.

Underwhelming. Visited with 3 friends as part of our trip to ubud, as it was well recommended on tripadvisor and te lonely planet. Our group enjoys some culture but none are major art fanatics. We didn't find the art particularly engaging, so wouldn't recommend unless you are into this style of art. We also thought it was quite expensive - 60k for an adult, and only took about an hour and a half to go round

Excellent overview of Balinese art in a beautiful setting. Once you enter, you will note the beautiful setting for the museum buildings, the gardens are not large but beautifully laid out and there is a lovely area for tea or refreshments or meals.However, the contents of the museum buildings are very impressive, showing the development of Balinese art over the centuries. A lovely place to spend an afternoon....
Very nice. very good locations attract more people to see. Inside are geogeus. A lot of collections from old old old year.... something you will never seen out side. Good to reccomend this..

Must see!. The museum grounds was calming. I walked from Blanco Museum to the center and was humid. As soon as I entered the grounds I felt relaxed. I love visiting art galleries and museums and this one tells about the history of the art scene in Bali. I was particularly taken by Walter Spies' story and planning to read his autobiography.

A great place to visit for Balinese arts. A visit to Ubud, Bali must include this museum which showcases Balinese arts history and paintings. The garden within the museum compound is delightful. The entrance fee includes refreshment at the cafeteria.

Bali's art community. Learn how Ubud's art community was organized and see a wonderful timeline of its evolution. The grounds offer a beautiful garden, lily pond with artwork throughout. Look for the hidden lady in the banyan trees.

A must see. A place to recharge and see amazing art and learn about the history of Ubud and art. Beautiful gardens right in the heart of Ubud. I am inspired to learn more about the art scene and history of Ubud after this visit.

An overview of balinese art. You can see examples of ancient paintings ( some a few centuries old ) and the evolution towards contemporary paintings , also the complex is an oasis of peace ,with beautiful gardens , and a nice restaurant , you can actually buy a joined ticket including a meal at the restaurant , for about 30 000 additional rupees
colorful culture. A must if you are traveling to Ubud. The grounds are beautiful, as well as the art. Afternoon tea is included in the admission fee, a nice touch.

Really enjoyed this museum! Get the lunch menu here!. We randomly stumbled upon this museum walking from Ubud Palace and the Saraswati Temple. It is a really nice museum, museum grounds are like a garden. The museum mainly houses what they call modern Indonesian art, which has a lot of almost psychedelic and spiritual painting mixed with Hindu stories. There is also, of course, depictions of the daily Balinese life. There are three halls and takes about 1-1.5 hours depending on how fast you take in the art. I enjoyed it all very much.And a nice surprise is the restaurant here. It was absolutely amazing, fresh, authentic and great value. For only $10-15, you can get appetizer, main, dessert and drink. We got caught in the rain here, but just ended up spending a few hours at the restaurant, taking it in. With the sound of the raindrops on the ceiling, overlooking the beautiful garden, and having the delicious food was one of my favorite experiences in Bali and one of my favorite experiences ever for a rainy day.

Excellent summary of the evolution of Balinese art. The museum is set in a beautiful garden and has 4 pavillons. It displays a comprehensive collection of Balinese art (painting and sculpture) spanning from the traditional to more contempary styles. Definetely worth seeing.

Ok to get a feel for Balinese art. This museum had 4 buildings, each with artwork from Bali. Only the first was air conditioned so be prepared to be very hot as you peruse the works (hotter inside even with the fans going than it was outside). A quick walk through is worth the effort but the heat does not encourage too much lingering.

Beautiful Oasis in centre of town.. The first of four display houses you come to on your left is the most impressive - a mix of photography, sculpture and some striking paintings. Also gives you some historical context on the art scene in ubud. The gardens are strikingly beautiful in their own right.
One of the Oldest Art Museums in Ubud. I first visited it in 1987 on my very first visit and over the years they keep adding to their collection its worth a visit to see traditional Balinese art

An oasis in the centre of touristy Ubud. Tucked away 500 metres from touristy Ubud is this oasis of calm.Beautiful grounds, Balinese art and your entrance Rp85k ticket also entitles you to a Balinese snack and ice drink at the cafe.A perfect respite from the hordes.

Lovely artwork, relaxing grounds. A beautiful museum which I found really easy to understand even though I am a complete art novice.Each Picture had an explanation in Bahasa and English. The grounds are also lovely, and there were people playing beautiful music. The 85,000 ticket gets you a free drink as well as your entry or we were offered a ticket for 115,000 RP which included a set lunch. Well worth it if you dig traditional art in tranquil settings

A must visit in Ubud. Great museum located in a wonderful building in the art town. The painting exhibition is truly fascinating and The museum does a great job of sharing this emotionally charged story, along with fascinating supporting information and artistic.
very beautiful. very nice art museum. Tickets were cheap and we received a little surprise at the end, a nice drink and complimentary dessert. It was a lovey afternoon.

This museum is expensive. This museum has an important collection of Balinese paintings,
we were interested to go and spend time looking at these, but
the entrance ticket cost 80.000 rph each, so we declined to go in.

Beautiful, tranquil setting - worth seeing for the grounds. It's worth visiting this museum just for the grounds - they are stunning and right in the middle of central Ubud. The collection didn't mean too much because we don't know that much about Balinese art.

Interesting but lacks diversity. This is a beautiful location...right in the centre of Ubud and easy to access. It is a expansive area of gardens and individual buildings housing different eras of Balinese/Indonesian and Western art....but we were a little disappointed that there were not more displays of Balinese photography and Balinese artifacts/woodcarvings. However, we enjoyed our visit and would recommend it to others.

Fascinating old and modern Balinese art. I enjoyed my visit to Puri Lukisan very much. They have a great variety of exhibited paintings, from old to modern ones, and at my time of visit some of the artists of the modern paintings were hanging around so you could have a chat with them about their work. The gardens are beautiful and after your walk through the 4 gallery buildings you can get complementary tea or coffee at the museum cafe.
Excellent museum. The museum is located in an amazing garden. Buy a ticket with the possibillity to take your time for the lunch with a drink in the restaurant
Incomplete. Very good exhibition, however it is a painting gallery, most of them are history, a little bit more of explanation or onformation available regarding the culture will help.

confirmed for me that I'm not a fan of modern balinese art!. the setting of the museum is lovely, but I'd only go if you are really interested in modern balinese art. This said we saw a couple really enjoying a wood carving workshop they were doing there.

Excellent setting and art . Conveinently located right on the main road it is worth the $6 USD entry ticket which includes a drink. The selection of art and carvings and excellent and offer a nice range. The wood benches that are provides are amazing art pieces themselves. The grounds and the setting is absolutely amazingly beautiful. The lighting in buildings could use an upgrade allowing you to see the art better.

Not worth the entrance money - go to the Neko instead.. The buildings were pleasant bur the artwork is mainly of a religious theme which is hardly truly representative of Balinese art. Given the excellent variety of art museums around Ubud (Neko and Blanco for a start) the 75000Rp makes this place not good value for money. And everywhere there are donations boxes asking for money to help conserve the artwork - why is this place so expensive to run that it can't afford to conserve the very things that tourists are paying to see? This is in a prominent position in Ubud and I think would not offer any encouragement for tourists to see other museums if they go here first.

Evokes a bye gone era. Fabulous buildings in a very central location. The artwork was well presented and gave one a good cross section of 19 - 20th century Balinese art. The restaurant is excellent and the "including meal" option is well worth it. Lovely gardens

Great collection and very informative. The museum is spread across a few buildings in a beautifully landscaped area. Good way to learn about Balinese culture, art, and the influence of western artists. There were only a few others visiting the museum on the day we went, and that created a very calm environment, in contrast to Ubud! The museum is just steps away from central Ubud.
Art museum. The art works were so beautiful and created such an insight into Balinese culture. Unmissable! The letters from Sen Robert Kennedy and continued correspondence not to be missed.

Great place to have lunch, take a class, and see art!. I stumbled upon this place because I was struck by the doors and wanted to see what was inside. So happy I did! I had lunch overlooking the terraces, (delicious, traditional and tasty!) then walked through the four buildings housing art. I was able to speak with a family taking a batik course and see what they made and I was very jealous I didn't take this class! Again, beautiful Balinese grounds! I think it's great to go enjoy and learn but also our support reinforces the importance of preservation! Definitely worth a visit!
Lovely art gallery. nice art and people performing music etc. I got to play a musical instrument made out of bamboo. Lots of fun.

Lovely museum. Four buildings with a wonderful representation of modern and traditional Balinese art in a beautiful open garden. Selected works , so not overwhelming and as such was easy to tour with kids. Fish pond which was another child friendly feature of our visit. Peaceful and relaxing after a day of busy Ubud walking. Worth a stop!
We enjoyed the visit. Beautiful setting and interesting exhibits. We were glad we took the time to visit this museum...it took us a couple of hours to peruse.
View the past of Bali. I liked the setting and the loving selection of paintings - you won't easily find a better time warp collection.

Lucky lukisan ,. One of the very best museum in Ubud & the by far the most conveniently situated.Pay special attention to the Wayan style paintings the first room when enter and do note that many artistic activities are on there on a daily basis.

Interesting place. a real mix of different arts and craft with a bit of history thrown in . Go early in the day some gallery's are a bit hot. Complementary cuppa with the entry price is nice in beautiful garden setting

Lovely grounds and cafe. The real assets of this art museum are its lovely grounds and cafe. It's a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the main road in Ubud - and you can hardly even hear the scooters! We enjoyed it so much that we had lunch at the cafe which is priced for tourists, but the food was really good and the service lovely - on the whole, definitely worth it to enjoy the peace and quiet a little longer!

Go for the grounds. The setting of this museum is stunning, I was less taken with the artwork inside. It was a nice way to pass an hour or so in the rain. If you are pressed for time, you won't miss out by skipping this.
Nice Experience. Very lush and pretty grounds, excellent artwork, temple instruments on display and they offer classes too!

Good collection of Balinese art. Well worth a visit, a quite comprehensive collection of Balinese art. Well presented and labeled, but some prior knowledge of Hindu/Balinese mythology (or a good guide) could make a visit even more rewarding. Nice cafe.

Grounds and art. The exhibition of art is interesting. The myth/legend behind the painting is given alongside the exhibit. You learn a lot about the culture through these explanations. Allow a good three hours to enjoy it fully.

Don't miss it. Very interesting and beautiful paintings and sculptures, a gorgeous garden too. You can also take some courses there, Batik and painting, which I would definitely recommend. I could spend a whole day there between the art, gardens,courses and reading a book in the cafe, but even a couple of hours is enough and worth while.

great museum. This museum has beautiful grounds, the layout is stunning. The art is fantastic, we were somewhat focussed on Bonnet's paintings and although Bonnet has donated many paintings to the museum there were few on display made by himself, which was a pity.

Refuge from Town. Lovely little detour away from the bustling streets of Ubud, yet only steps away. We learned a bit about Indonesian (Balinese) art and enjoyed strolling around the cool garden. You can keep your ticket and return throughout the day to reclaim your calm.

Needs lighting. Interesting artwork, but like many indonesian museums needs some better curating and much better lighting. Flourescent bulbs hanging on ceiling just won't cut it. Grounds are beautiful, though. Nice, cool getaway

Great Lay-Out And A Amazing Experience. we arrived at the museum on a busy day in Ubud with my 10 year old and we both loved it, the layout was great and artwork were unbelievable and historical, if you like art come to this museum

Lovely grounds. My daughter and I went for a short visit and we enjoyed the sculpture and the balinese art. Peace in the busy central Ubud. I went to this museum by accident. It is located in the middle of busy street of Ubud central and yet I skipped it for too many times. Peaceful. That is the first impression. A tranquil place with beautiful garden. It was rainy. I bet it'd be nice to sit in the garden to read or just sit.The collection is interesting. I particularly like the exhibition of Gusti Nyoman Lempad’s life and work. It provides a glimpse to Bali paintings that rarely known. They are like door to the culture and rich in stories.I spent one and half hour in this museum.If only I knew it earlier, I might sign up for one of their classes.

Heart of Art in Ubud. We visited the museum, there are 4 main halls in total and our entrance fee came with a free drink. Lovely place to spend the afternoon. We were expecting to have a quick look through the museum and move on, we left 3 hours later. The grounds are lovely and the art is very interesting. The entrance fee includes a hot or cold drink.

Nice atmosphere, great art. The art was beautiful and the grounds were too! We were only able to spend about an hour at the museum, but it was still great. And your ticket comes with a cup of iced tea! Nice touch in the heat.

Perfect for a bit of 'me' time. Loved the art and found the art museum informative as well. And I took the opportunity to enjoy a cake and drink (complementary) at the cafe in the most gorgeous setting as the galleries and cafe are built around a beautiful peaceful garden / lily pond. Great introduction to Balinese art. This was our first gallery visited in Bali and a great introduction to Balinese art. It has an interesting history with European influences coming through. loved it ..... Loved learning about the culture of the country through the artwork and fable telling... a great visit and we stayed and had lunch which was a surprising treat and what can i say about the dessert.... grilled banana dessert with palm sugar and grated cheese topping !!!!

Good museum of Balinese art from 1920's to present. The museum has several pavilions with a permanent collection and one with a changing collection. The gardens around it are nice and peaceful. A great way to spend one or two hours.

Best museum in Ubud!. This place was mind blowing!

The Lempad collection was my favorite. The adult only section offered a peak at Balinese sexuality.
The cafe was great. I wish I had not eaten beforehand but don't regret having the best pork ever around the corner at Ibu Oka.
Totally recommend!

Very nice Bali art collection in a nice setting. The place is beautiful and peaceful, you can enjoy the art collection on display at your own pace without hordes of visitors.

How lucky we were to see the Lembak exhibition. This museum was a highlight for me. I went back many times just to walk in the gardens and experience the serenity. How lucky we were to see the Lembak exhibition - this place, along with the palace, for me is the heart of Ubud.

Free tea at the end was a nice perk, and only $7 for entry.
Worth a visit. Very agreeable museum, composed of different buildings on a large property with a little pond. A great way to discover Balinese art. A free drink and snack is offered!

Very good time investment. in the middle if Ubud you can find a very well developed as well as presented art gallery retreat. With partings by local artists as well as Bonnet and Spies, it is certainly worth the time.
A must see!. Beautiful gardens and a chance to learn about Ubud history and culture as well as experience magnificent art in the gallery.

A tour of Ubud's palaces. Worth a visit lovely gardens, interesting art galleries, small enough to not take up too much time or energy in the heat! complimentary drink with entrance ticket which was very welcome at end of visit. Live Music playing to enhance experience.
